page.title: 06Aldworth Church
page.content: The oldest part of the church is the lower half of the tower,dating from the 12th century.The nine effigies, probably made of Caen stone, were carved between approximately 1300 and 1350.Their age makes them of great intrest aswell as the fact that they contain so many of the De La Beche family in one parish church. Even in their damaged state they are quite remarkable.Legend says there used to be a passage from the De La Beche manor house to the church.In the churchyard there is a Yew tree that is estimated to be over 1000.It was struck by lightning on January 2nd 1976.In the church there are some candlesticks made from the tree.
